pullRequest.title: [DOC] Rework on data storage considerations section
pullRequest.bodyText:
Signed-off-by: prmellor pmellor@redhat.com
Documentation
Rework of Data storage considerations section.
The text was not clear and contradictory.
Checklist
Please go through this checklist and make sure all applicable tasks have been done

 Update/write design documentation in ./design
 Write tests
 Make sure all tests pass
 Update documentation
 Check RBAC rights for Kubernetes / OpenShift roles
 Try your changes from Pod inside your Kubernetes and OpenShift cluster, not just locally
 Reference relevant issue(s) and close them after merging
 Update CHANGELOG.md

commit.message:
Rework on data storage considerations section

Signed-off-by: prmellor <pmellor@redhat.com>

nodes.bodyText: These all different types of block storage, right?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -8,9 +8,19 @@
 
 An efficient data storage infrastructure is essential to the optimal performance of {ProductName}.
 
-{ProductName} requires block storage and is designed to work optimally with cloud-based block storage solutions, including Amazon Elastic Block Store (EBS). The use of file storage (for example, NFS) is not recommended.
+Block storage is a good choice.
+File storage (for example, NFS) is not recommended.
 
-Choose local storage (local persistent volumes) when possible. If local storage is not available, you can use a Storage Area Network (SAN) accessed by a protocol such as Fibre Channel or iSCSI.
+By block storage, we do not mean using Kubernetes raw block volumes.
+
+Instead, choose:

+

+* Cloud-based block storage solutions, including {aws-ebs}
+
+It is recommended that you configure your storage system to use the _XFS_ file system.
